    Annual (maxima or minima) aggregation

    annual.agg.Rd

    Annual (maxima or minima) aggregation

    annual.agg(
  x,
  time,
  index = as.character(lubridate::year(time)),
  dd = c(1, 2, 5),
  aggr.fun = "max",
  na.rm = TRUE,
  dd_formatter = "D%03d",
  numeric_dd = TRUE,
  numeric_index = FALSE,
  aggr.name = "aggr",
  dd.name = "dd",
  index.name = "index",
  filter = lapply(dd, function(dd) {
rep(1, dd)/dd
 }),
  method = "convolution",
  sides = 1,
  return_vector = FALSE,
  order_time = TRUE,
  speed_up = FALSE,
  ...
)

yearly.agg(x, time, ...)

    Arguments

    x

    vector or time series

    time

    vector of time index (e.g. Date or POSIXct)

    index

    index aggregation vector. Default is

    dd

    duration for the moving window. More than 1 duration can be assigned.

    aggr.fun

    atomic aggregation function (e.g. max or min), accepting na.rm argument.

    na.rm

    argument for aggr.fun

    dd_formatter

    string formatter for duration in the function value

    numeric_dd

    logical. Default is TRUE.

    numeric_index

    logical. Default is FALSE.

    aggr.name, dd.name, index.name

    optional column names of function results. See function usage.

    filter, method, sides, ...

    further arguments for stats::filter

    return_vector

    logical. If TRUE function return a vector through df2vec. Default is FALSE.

    order_time

    logical argument, if it TRUE x is ordered following increasing data

    speed_up

    logical argument

    Value

    a data frame or similar with index (e.g. year or year-month), duration (column name: "dd") and the aggregated value (column name: "aggr")

    See also

    stats::filter,max,min

    Examples

    
library(RMAWGEN)
#> Loading required package: chron
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘chron’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:lubridate’:
#> 
#>     days, hours, minutes, seconds, years
#> Loading required package: date
#> Loading required package: vars
#> Loading required package: MASS
#> Loading required package: strucchange
#> Loading required package: zoo
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘zoo’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     as.Date, as.Date.numeric
#> Loading required package: sandwich
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘strucchange’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:stringr’:
#> 
#>     boundary
#> Loading required package: urca
#> Loading required package: lmtest
data(trentino)
time <- as.Date(sprintf("%04d-%02d-%02d",PRECIPITATION$year,
PRECIPITATION$month,PRECIPITATION$day),format="%Y-%m-%d")
x <- PRECIPITATION$B8570

out <- annual.agg(x,time)
out2 <- yearly.agg(x,time)


outv <- annual.agg(x,time,return_vector=TRUE)
outv1 <- vec2df(outv)

if (!identical(out,outv1)) stop("Something went wrong!")

library(lmom)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:MASS’:
#> 
#>     select
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
outp <- out %>% filter(dd==2)
evplot(outp$aggr)




outm <- annual.agg(x,time,index=sprintf("%04d_%02d",lubridate::year(time),lubridate::month(time)))
outmd <- annual.agg(x,time,index=sprintf("%04d_%02d",lubridate::year(time),lubridate::month(time)),aggr.fun=function(l,...) {which.max(l)})

### intesity greater or equal to 10 mm per day. 
funthres <- function(r,valmin=10,...) {length(which(r>=valmin))}
out_funthres <- annual.agg(x,time,index=sprintf("%04d_%02d",lubridate::year(time),lubridate::month(time)),aggr.fun=funthres)
